Posts.Content: May 24, 2011 06:44PM karen333 wrote: Traxy, you should be getting your mammogram now and it will reveal the problem or the results could suggest an MRI, This is the worst moment just waiting for results, just keep putting one foot in front of the other and you will make it through.  We will all be waiting on the news so can congratulate or supprt you, so let us know how things progress.  Sending prayers and gentle hugs your way.  Karen
Posts.Title: what i thought was a ruptured implant may be bc instead trayxdogg karen333

Posts.Content: Jul 26, 2010 06:34PM karen333 wrote: Dear sohard,  I remember being told that the biopsy was positive for cancer and those were the only one's I heard.  I am coming up on my year anniversary now and frequently don't even think of the cancer.  I am now because I am coming up on my one year mammo, US and Mri.  I read on one post some great advice, Don't think about next month, next week, all you have to do is show up for today's treatment. You've come on a great site for info, advice, emotional support, and extremely knowlegabel women.  I still use it almost every day, and stay in contact via email and phone calla with one women I met here.  You are not alone, we are all here for you  Karen
Posts.Title: I have cancer...It is sinking in...uuuggghhh... Ondagrow Ondagrow

Posts.Content: Apr 23, 2011 03:50PM karen333 wrote: Dear yellow lady, I lost my godmother 2 mos. ago and miss her desperately.  She was my best friend, I still cry and I'll keep crying till I'm all  cried out.  I wish I had a recording, a voice mail ao I could hear her again.  There just seems to be a part of my heart is gone with her passing.  Telling happy stories or memories of special time with her will help, and I'm glad you came here to tell the story.  When it had just happened, the women on Two sites helped hold me and sent prayers, hugs, and listened to me, really remarkable women who will step in to help, to listen to my stories, I still PM to 2 friends especially and hear back in minutes.  I cry for you, help us know your stepsis, tell us your special relationship.  Feel free to PM me.  (((((((HUGS)))))))  Karen
Posts.Title: So Freaking Sad yellowdoglady karen333

Posts.Content: Oct 24, 2010 04:56PM - edited Oct 24, 2010 05:22PM by karen333 You're getting the opinion of some of the most  knowledgeable women on the boards.  I am over a year out and it's not part of my thoughts 24/7 anymore.  I still got scananxiety fears at the one year mammo and ultra sound tests.  I also have a diagnosis similar to your's.  If your thoughts are escalating,  don't forget support groups, these boards,  friends you can be real with, counseling and anti-anxiety meds.  I was free and clear on both tests, and am building the new me.
Posts.Title: Shameless Request for Support LisaMomOfFour gentianviolet

Posts.Content: Oct 6, 2010 04:22PM karen333 wrote: You can also call your local American Cancer Society and explain your situation.  They can help with finding funding or free mammogram clinics.  I would not wait til Dec., when it is possible to access funding now.
Posts.Title: Not sure what to think or do... rollergirl78 Beesie

Posts.Content: May 14, 2012 04:48PM karen333 wrote: Nervous Nellie, you are reacting very normally, as others have said stay off the Internet - I did that for a few days and it made everything worse, I was convinced I had everything I read about.  Keep coming here for support and encouragement, and use this time to do distracting things that will engage your mind, I watched every funny movie I could think of, I did some gardening, did my yoga and relaxation tapes and listened to my favorite music at an unbelievably loud volume, so I could get lost in the music.  When I was driving I also blasted the music and sang along, I'm sure I looked like a loon.  And sounded worse, I also exercised, you wouldn't think so but that helped the most, got the endorphins moving.  Take care and keep us informed, Karen

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2010 05:48PM karen333 wrote: I am a 1 yr. 1 mo. survivor, my cousin is at 7 yrs., my godmother is a 26 yr. survivor.  She is 87 yrs. old and is still going strong, she still looks nifty in her polo shirt and jeans.
Posts.Title: How many years have you been a Survivor? IllinoisNancy Lou789

Posts.Content: Jan 2, 2011 03:21PM karen333 wrote: I too think you should try to find a Breast Surgeon.  My doctor only does breast surgery and I had a Lumpectomy and SNB.  Came out of it with no lymph involvement and clean margins.  I could have had the surgery in the city I lived in with just a surgeon, but choose to travel instead.  As my gyn. said, "if it were my wife, I'd go the Breast Care Center and ask them for their recommendation". Everyone on my team was current, caring, knowledgeable and professional.  My BS even gives out his cell phone number and encourages you to call if a problem comes up.  Karen
Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed :( loving_mother nwest125

Posts.Content: Dec 29, 2010 09:23PM karen333 wrote: loving_mother, You are limited to 5 posts per day until you reach, i think it is 25 or 50 posts. But you can PM as many people as you like each day if you have questions or worries.  Just click on the person"s picture or Name [if there is no pic], and it will direct you in sending a message.  I had a lumpectomy a year and a half ago, and there is no obvious difference in size, the breast with the cancer is a little "perkier".  I also had 7 weeks of rads and am now on Arimidex for 5 years,  I have a few side effects from the med., but it is very doable.  Be sure you have picked a BS who you can place your trust in, one that listens to ypur questions and answers them fully.  I was very lucky when the Breast Care Center I go to suggested my surgeon.  He even has his cell phone # on his card and I did use it once when I got an infection, it was early evening and it was such a relief to hear him answer.  Feel free to PM me if you need to  Karen
Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed :( loving_mother nwest125

Posts.Content: Apr 14, 2012 05:27PM - edited Apr 14, 2012 05:29PM by karen333 NoMoreHL, there is also a site called Great Saying About Depression, and their premise is depression is not a weakness, it's a sign that you have had to be strong for so long.  And you did have to be strong going through all the active treatment, the depression and anxiety seem to settle in at the one year mark when you are beginning to process ALL that has gone on.  Add to that all the Dr. appointments coming up and it is a cruel awakening of bc.  I was Dx in August of 2009, I still get nervous on those cancerverary dates, it brings everything to the forefront again with all the tests and appointments, that is the case for many of us.  BC.org was a genuine lifesaver for me, I found a group of women in my geographical area who communicate on the thread each day and meet for luncheon once a month, it is like being enveloped in love and understanding.  I also see a therapist, as do all but one member of our group of 8 and am taking an antidepressant.  The world is bright again and I have my joy back, not to say I don't have down days, getting outside in the sunlight is imperative.  Even if it is a trip to the store to get a few things or sitting on your porch.  Also if you come by someone you really feel is living your life as it is now, reach out and PM them, it just may result in a beautiful friendship developing.  It does require a little bit of faith to reach out like that but out of 3 reaches I have found 2 fast and true cyber friends, who I "talk" to almost every day.  So glad you seem to have turned a corner and that you found a Dr. who prescribed an antidepressant, it is just the edge you needed.  Take care, Karen  PS,. we have a luncheon today, it feels great to meet all my girlfriends.
Posts.Title: Running out of places to turn to for help NoMoreHL karen333

Posts.Content: Nov 22, 2010 01:19AM karen333 wrote: can lymphedema present a year and a half after lumpectomy and rads?  My left breast is tender and swollen, I am being treated for infected seroma with antibiotics.  I have been on them for a week and there is a little improvement.  That breast has been asperated twice and that brought relief instantly.  Karen

Posts.Content: Jul 1, 2010 03:22PM karen333 wrote: I had 1 palpable mass on my left breast and then on the MRI they found 1 little tumor, they were close and the lumpectomy is not that great a scar, though the BS called it a partial mastectomy and that freaked me out.  Waiting is the absolute worst part truthfully.  I had 8 weeks of radiation and now am on Arimidex, had my 6 mo. all clear mammogram.  I'll be holding you in my thoughts.  Karen

Posts.Content: May 17, 2012 10:39PM karen333 wrote: Sparky, so sorry to hear the news, sending calming thoughts from your old home town, Batavia.  You should be getting the beginnings of a plan in place, that will give you a kind of peace to know what comes next.  I know that through the stress of appts., tests and scans, one woman's post stayed in my head, "all you have to do is show up", and that's all you need to do.  Start building your circle of support, your family, friends and of course bc.org sisters, we will always be here.  You may want to stop in to the Invasive Ductal Carcinoma group as they will be familiar with what you are facing, they will wecome you with open arms.  Karen

Posts.Content: Dec 24, 2010 02:16PM - edited Dec 24, 2010 02:17PM by karen333 Cathi, you were certainly due for a meltdown, I would have had mine weeks ago.  Don't let them ruin your Christmas.  As Barbe said - if things get bad, invite them to leave, you do not have to take it.  I had to ask my daughter to stay at home with me, but he HAD to leave,  Much pleading on my daughter's part, but she made the choice to leave.  Tough love is so hard to do, but it is the only thing that works.  She eventually made her choice to leave him and she is now my best friend.  You' ll cry and feel like a monster, but it is the only thing to do.  take care  Karen

Posts.Content: Dec 15, 2010 11:16PM karen333 wrote: Cathi, it just breaks your heart to hear of these children.  I know that their is a huge turnover in social workers my cousin lasted as a caseworker for 10 years then had to leave because of the push for reunification.  You have to believe DCF workers are aware of cases where reunification should not reoccur at all or needs to be ever so gradually phased in.  My 87 yr. old godmother always tells me that the plan for your life is already written by God, and this would have to be doubly so for little ones.  May he hold Landon and Ella in the palm of his hand right now and keep them safe. My godmother had a full mastectomy in 1984, no chemo - no rads - no AI's and is still going strong.  Her belief in a compassionate God who has written our lives is very strong.  You are all in my thoughts and prayers.  I am so sorry this is all happening.  And look at you, Cathi, checking case law, you go girl.  Karen  rest easily tonight Miema

Posts.Content: Apr 12, 2011 04:23PM karen333 wrote: Cathi, was away for a few days and just saw your post.  When my daughter and I were estranged, I would drive from Va. where I was living to Buffalo to see her and the children.  Like you I never knew what to expect, and inevitably would be bad or worse, I would cry all the way home.  So I totally respect you coming to the boards to stay sane, I would lean on a few good friends and they never tired of me and my sometimes embarassing stories. So vent away.  Before she had her wakeup call and started to drastically change her life, which Amanda has to do too, I had threatened to take her to court for custody.  As you said I did not know where my true daughter was and thought she was gone from me forever, and I did not like or respect who she was then.  Take heart, your daughter may again emerge, but for now it seems like you and Ed have a great tough love plan in place and you and the school system are on guard for Ella and Landen and your daughter, Jaclyn is a strong support for you and the children.  It is bad enough that our children become involved with drugs, but when there are children involved it is a true heartache for them. hugs, Karen

Posts.Content: Dec 29, 2010 09:00PM karen333 wrote: Cathi, I hope the MRI shows nothing of significance.  Do you rest while the kids are at daycare?  I don't imagine you are much of a rester, but you really need to be gentle with yourself when you can.  Just dealing with 2 pre-schoolers is a full time job.  I know 20 years ago when I was a preschool teacher I was ready for bed at 9:30 most nights, shortly after I put my daughter to bed.  And there was no hint of cancer to contend with then.  Karen

Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2011 04:08PM karen333 wrote: sorry you are in so much pain Cathi, so glad SIL was working too.  Of course you miss them, they have been with you every single day up till recently.  It's like when I am watching over the kids and their friends while DD works, and the noise level with stereo is making the floors vibrate.  But then the friends all go home and my kids go to a sleepover - then the house is too quiet, especially if they're gone for a full day, I miss them.  Hope the weather stays warm and sunny for you, Karen

Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2011 06:55PM karen333 wrote: Cathi, I teared up when you said Ella was kind of wandering around then just layed her head on your lap, Ed is just a lifesaver isn't he?  I hope you get a really good caseworker, one that is concientous and easy to talk to.  My cousin was a case worker for 10 years then had to leave as she was burned out by the cases like you heard in court.  She was civil service with pension, sick benefits, etc..., but needed to be on anti-depressants for the last year she worked.  Ended up working 2 part time jobs, no benefits.  Can you imagine the pain they see and feel for their little clients, that is why the turnover is high in that job.  Just hope Amanda will come to her senses and kick SIL to the curb, and realize she is now living her life for the children.  I am always reminded by your circumstances how hard it was to see my daughter in that spot of her life.  I honestly felt I had a hole in my heart for her and my grandchildren.  I'm sure you feel the same.  hugs, Karen
Posts.Title: please help sueps barbe1958

Posts.Content: Jul 27, 2010 01:46PM karen333 wrote: Dear Cathi, I have read this site since the first post, but did not feel like I needed to offer advice since you had a great cadre of friends advising you.  You have been doing superwoman duty for so long and with such a powerful love for the children.  Time for you to take a rest.  In my previous life I was a day care teacher, and the program offered many caring activities done by dedicated staff.  I can honestly say that my team and I offered an outpouring of love for our children.  Just consider them as an extended family helping with Ella.  The socialization, art activities, guided play, gross motor opportunities can only benefit her and by extension you.  You are one amazing lady.  Karen

Posts.Content: Jan 6, 2011 07:31PM karen333 wrote: Dear EWB, oncologist thinks the slight rise may be due to the fact that I am a smoker, so I became a non-smoker today, it was something I said I was going to do after being diagnosed in Aug.09.  I   am to see BS on Mon., onc. thinks infected seroma I had is still infected, since it is still warm and slightly larger.  I thought it had gone down quite a bit. aspirated 2x and 2 courses of antibiotics.  The beast never sleeps does it.  Just when you think you have your feet on the ground, they get swept out again.  I keep telling myself it is what it is and worrying isn't going to change anything.  Did find a new PCP, woman Dr. I have heard good things about and will fire old one for his behavior and attitude in telling me TA's were up.  He has always been condescending, this was over the line. I feel a little calmer now that I am taking action.  Thank you for your concern, hugs back at you  Karen

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2011 11:37AM - edited Jan 24, 2011 11:47AM by karen333 And so it starts, the phone calls for money,just remember if you give in once, she will be conditioned to expect it from  now on.  Make sure the caseworker is aware of it and that she missed classes.  If she missed, thenSIL missed too. Their choice to do so Cathi.  And if it means jail time, although that might be a bluff, that was their choice too.  Then Landen and Ella will be back safe and sound with you.  You feel bad because it is so hard to be so tough, but partof  DD's reality has to be she depends on herself not you for finances.  Be brave.  Karen  Part 2 - she just upped the ante by showing up at your house for a face to face talk.  As far as the upcoming weekend goes, it is possible she"ll skip it, with no food for the household.  Make sure the caseworker is aware of all tthat is going on .
